discord-tip: Pick a date or enter a timestamp above.
faq-a1: A Discord timestamp is a special code (like <t:TIMESTAMP:f>) that displays a formatted date/time in chat, auto-adjusted to each user's timezone.
faq-q2: How do I use these codes in Discord?
faq-a2: Copy any code above and paste it directly into your Discord message. Discord will render it as a formatted date/time for everyone.
faq-a3: Supported formats: short/long date, short/long time, short/long datetime, and relative time. See the preview list above for details.
faq-q4: Can I use a UNIX timestamp?
faq-a4: Yes! Enter a UNIX timestamp or pick a date/time. The tool will generate all Discord timestamp codes for you.
faq-q5: Why does the preview show numbers?
faq-a5: Discord only renders these codes inside Discord chat. Here you see the raw code to copy and paste.
